attributes.action: Lower the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the equivalent of Scotland
attributes.background:
In England and Wales, the alcohol limit for drivers is 80 milligrammes of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. On December 5th 2014 the alcohol limit for drivers in Scotland reduced from 80 to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood.
This is far safer.
attributes.additional_details:
The Scottish Government say they have changed their drink drive limit to bring Scotland in line with most other European countries, to save lives and make Scotland’s roads safer.
Many of the functions that we depend on to drive safely are affected when we drink alcohol: 
the brain takes longer to receive messages from the eye
processing information becomes more difficult
slower reaction times.
blurred and double vision, affects your ability to see things clearly while you are driving.

attributes.action: Raise the lifetime ISA upper age limit from 40 to 45.
attributes.background: The 40 year upper limit for the new life time ISA is too low. People upto the age of 45 should have this opportunity as well.

attributes.action: Introduce other religious leaders into the house of lords to make it democratic
attributes.background: The only religious leaders in the House of Lords are bishops and arch bishops but as Britain is now a multi faith country other religious leaders from Muslim, Hindu and Sikh (etc) faiths should be entered to the house in order to offer greater representation and democracy and scrutiny in Britain.

attributes.action: Make it the law for all UK eateries to sell gluten free & lowfat dairy free food
attributes.background: Only a small amount of cafés in the UK offer gluten free & dairy free food. Some offer vegan and vegatarian food. It would be great if it was the law for all cafés and restaurants in the UK to provide food for all dietary issues then this would lessen suffering of uk long-term health improving life

attributes.action: Reimburse UK companies of tariffs when trading with the EU, if the UK leaves EU.
attributes.background: If UK left the EU there would be a renegotiation period. In this period companies will need to pay tariffs. This petition is to protect all UK businesses that rely on EU free-trade agreement. This idea would mean UK Government would reimburse UK companies on tariffs, using tariffs received from EU.
attributes.additional_details: With the UK trading at a deficit with the EU, more tariffs will be paid by EU companies to our Government than UK companies to EU Governments. A new Tariff Reimbursement Transition Period could be introduced to help our companies trading with the EU. This will mean our Government reimburses UK companies on tariffs paid to EU Governments using money received in tariffs from EU companies. This would effectively make it free trade for UK companies whilst the UK negotiate free trade deals with EU.

attributes.action: Make the selling of electronic devices with pre-installed malware/adware illegal
attributes.background: A lot of low-end tablets and phones come with pre-installed malware and ad-ware that is a big security risk for the user, normally it is also not possible to remove these

attributes.action: Introduce Dental Receptionists to be registered professionals with the GDC
attributes.background: I believe it's important for all dental receptionists to feel they are as important as registered professionals. Dental receptionists are the first and last point of call for patients.
attributes.additional_details: I also believe that it would give dental receptionists a higher profile and feel important to the dental team. I have spoken to a dental receptionist and she has stated that she believes it's important for these changes to be made as it would benefit the dental services and feels it would have a positive impact on dental receptionists to feel as important as the rest of the dental team.  I believe that they should be registered with the general dental council to have a responsibility for keeping up to date with standards and prove that they are continuing personal development but also be accountable for their actions.

attributes.action: Ban companies from selling sweatshop made products in the UK
attributes.background: There are children as young as 6 and 7 working 16 hour weeks for as little as 18p an hour. We want the UK government to ban companies who employ people under 16 in factories selling those clothes in this country. We want fair working hours for all and improved working conditions.
attributes.additional_details: If worker were to have their wages doubled that would be a significant amount of money for them but to us it would mean an increase of just 1.8% which is nothing. We want the UK to ban companies who use sweatshops from selling those products in this country. We want the UK government to apply more pressure on the UN to do more to bring a complete end to sweatshops.

attributes.action: Recognise Israel's atrocities against Palestinians and take action to stop it.
attributes.background:
Israel continues to breach the human rights of Palestinians in its illegal occupation of the West Bank  and Gaza. 

I, as a UK citizen petition the UK Government to take action to isolate Israel in the international community until it changes its course and ends its apartheid against Palestinians.
attributes.additional_details:
The action should include:

1. Draft a fresh UN resolution. 
2. Impose full sanctions against Israel
3. Stop selling arms.
4. Proscribe the IDF as a weapon of terror. 
5. Require a plebiscite open to all residents (including refugees) to vote for either a 1 State solution where everyone has 100% equal rights or for a 2 State solution where both States are recognised and have all the comensurate rights and responsibilities of nationhood. 
6. Establish a legal process to compensate Palestinians.

attributes.action: Give people in Overseas Territories & Crown Dependencies an EU referendum vote.
attributes.background: There are an estimated 350,000 British Citizens living in British Overseas Territories around the world and 250,000 British Citizens living in the Crown Dependencies of Jersey, Guernsey and the Isle of Mann. These people are also European Union Citizens and should be given a vote on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: The Overseas Territories and Crown Dependencies receive large sums of money from the European Union for development purposes. The Overseas Territory of Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha for example, with a population of around 8,000 people, relies heavily on the European Development Fund with the 11th EDF granting the territory 21.5 million Euros. The loss of such funding and other benefits of UK European Union membership would be devastating to such small island communities.

attributes.action: Refer Amazon to the competition authorities.
attributes.background: In The Telegraph interview Rohan Silva, a former adviser to David Cameron and George Osborne, said the lack of competition in the book market is “really horrifying”, allowing Amazon to dominate.I’m absolutely aghast about what the government and competition authorities have allowed Amazon to do.
attributes.additional_details:
What the Society of Authors and their memebers think of Amazon can be found here: http://www.societyofauthors.org/what-do-we-think-amazon

The background to this petition can be found at this link: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/shopping-and-consumer-news/12167545/Government-must-help-end-heartbreaking-Amazon-dominance-former-Number-10-adviser-says.html?WT.mc_id=e_DM89475&WT.tsrc=email&etype=Edi_Pol_New_EU&utm_source=email&utm_medium=Edi_Pol_New_EU_2016_02_22&utm_campaign=DM89475

attributes.action: Illegal to charge people more who are already in debt
attributes.background: When people are in debt it's normally because they don't have a lot of money. However debt collection agents and courts think it's fine to kick people when their down and put extra charges on .people need help not more debt Ie bailiff charge. Court charge
attributes.additional_details: People actually commit suicide because of debt and bully boy tactics. Court's don't help by putting more debt on with extra charges .more help needs to be given to people in debt. Not extra cost that increases that debt extra charges need to be illegal and just the original debt paid

attributes.action: Absent parent to have automatic access to education health and welfare records
attributes.background: In breakdown of relationships the absent parent is often powerless in obtaining information in relation to their child's education health and welfare. Unless safeguarding issues absent parent has automatic right to have direct access to health Records/results and school progress reports/exam results
attributes.additional_details: Asking hospital staff to be included in dialogue about their child as absent parent is frustrating and seems currently relies on asking the parent with care. There should be a set procedure in relation to this which should be documented and highlighted to ensure there are clear expectations and outcomes. Parents don't stop being parents Just because the relationship between their partner breaks down. There needs to be equity wuth both parents not automatic to parent with care.

attributes.action: re nationalise the energy companies
attributes.background: British Gas today announced an increase in profits to £574 million pounds a 31% increase, not for the first time that profits have increased. The regulator seems to be serving the energy companies and not the consumers who have to pay. I'm sure the dividend payed to shareholders will rise.
attributes.additional_details: Its about time consumers get a fair deal for the cost of energy. When we had Nationally owned energy companies it was the Government who decided on the cost. Wholesale gas prices have dropped by 40% and slowly the energy companies are reducing the cost but not fast and always after winter and never enough. Re Nationalise the energy companies or at the very least put in place a regulator who actually represents the consumers.

attributes.action: Delay EU membership referendum until EU Parliament approval for agreements
attributes.background: The British Parliament should prevent any referendum on British membership of the EU being held before European Parliamentary approval has been obtained for agreements made with EU leaders.
attributes.additional_details:
Agreements with EU leaders concerning UK renegotiations of membership will be subject to European Parliament’s approval and may result in modification to those agreements. Any referendum should therefore not be held until such approval has been obtained, otherwise the referendum would be based upon incomplete and perhaps erroneous information.
Alternatively if the referendum occurs before such approval and any significant changes are made during that process, a second referendum should be held

attributes.action: Let the public veto unpopular proposed government legislation by online vote.
attributes.background: The government shouldn't be able to enact widely derided and unpopular legislation that the people don't want. We need a system that allows the public to have a voice away from the voting booth at general elections.
attributes.additional_details: If more people sign up to veto a piece of proposed legislation than voted the government in at the last general election, then that legislation should automatically be vetoed. That would be true democracy, give an alternative to strike action, and would protect against the most destructive of government actions against the people they're supposed to represent.

attributes.action: Make take away shops use bio-degradable containers for serving food near beaches
attributes.background: I used to work on Brighton beach as a lifeguard. At high tide there would be a line of rubbish, much of it plastic, marking the high tide. As the tide began making its way back out there would be a thick line of rubbish left along the beach... what about the rubbish that was carried out to sea?!!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/environment/gallery/2009/apr/08/waste-marine-life what happens to the rubbish that is lost to the sea?

The Great Pacific Garbage Patch - The worlds largest plastic rubbish dump. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1qT-rOXB6NI
Banning plastic from the beaches will not cure the problem but we have to start somewhere.

attributes.action: The NHS must be funded by a separate tax, with all funds going exclusively to it
attributes.background: The NHS should not be a political football. We all value the NHS, we all want it funded. We don't want politicians playing with it for their own ends. A separate tax allows for the NHS to be funded by a specific tax which can be raised (or reduced) as necessary to fund the needs of the service.
attributes.additional_details:
We used to have a direct link between National Insurance and the NHS. Funds raised were used for the NHS. That link has been broken. We should allow people to pay more tax (an income tax which is progressive) for the NHS without necessarily raising the general rate of taxation.
Having the NHS fully funded by the taxpayer will reduce the possibility of politicians playing games with our health for their own political ends.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of over the counter codeine based pain killer medication
attributes.background: In the last few years there has been an increase in the number of people becoming addicted to OTC pain medication. This medication is a legal form of morphine and causes as many problems for people addicted to it as illegal class a and b drugs.
attributes.additional_details: People addicted to the medication do not cause problems for society, they do not steal property, mug people or cause the police service any problems at all. This is because the medication is very cheap, easy to get hold of and legal to have. People caught in the grip of addiction live on a day to day basis always needing to know they are able to get their fix, their lives are lived under dark clouds with often no help being offered to get away from it as it is not seen as a problem.

attributes.action: Make vaping bans illegal and regulate vaping fluid ingredients.
attributes.background:
Vaping is much safer than smoking, and causes no unpleasant odour. If the ridiculous bans on vaping of many establishments was made illegal, many more smokers would make the switch.

Many vaping "pre-mix" fluids contain needless toxic ingredients for "a smoother vape" and should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is for the good of public health.

If vaping indoors was a legal right, more people would invest in electronic cigarettes out of convenience alone. More people would make the switch and save the NHS millions in the long term, while nicotine tax would continue to provide government revenue.

Poor quality vaping fluids are the reason why people think vaping is unsafe. Pre-mix vaping fluids need only contain nicotine, base and flavour, as is already available but it should be the law.

attributes.action: Ban Free Pornoraphy Online. Regulate subscription Porn to safeguard under 18's
attributes.background: Paid for Professional Pornoraphy should be Government regulated to ensure no one is underage, and no one underage is subscribing to it. Free Pornoraphy cannot ensure these measures. It has infact lead to child abuse. Being exposed to such things at a young age should also be considered child abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Between data, Wifi spots and other people's devices, you cannot safeguard children and young people from exposure, by parental controls and filters alone. It is a disgrace that it is Online in the first place, and many involved, females and males, are likely being plied with drugs and alcohol.

attributes.action: Recognise colour blindness as a disability.
attributes.background: Our son is colour blind and is unable to help his children with colouring, conversations regarding colour etc, purchasing items etc. Please mark crayons, felt tips etc with the name of the colour enabling colour blind people to participate in normal parental activities.

attributes.action: Stop NHS appointment record cards advertising Claims Companies on them.
attributes.background: Seeing that a full page was allowed to be advertising and encouraging the general public to seek legal advise after visiting a hospital is encouraging people to become more litigious. The NHS is seen as advising people to seek out ways to make money by claiming and they are in a position of trust.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell more than 2 packets of paracetamol in one transaction
attributes.background: Retailers can sell 100 paracetamol in a single transaction, as long as the packets only contain 16 tablets. Some retailers limit it to 2 packets however this is individual store policy. This should become the law, as it will reduce accidental and intentional overdoses, saving lives and NHS money.
attributes.additional_details:
There are guidelines released by MHRA (The Medicines and Healthcare  products Regulatory Agency) recommending that sales are limited to two packets and does not occur within a promotional deal.

Limiting sales will not stop overdoses from occurring, but it will make people more conscious of the dangers of paracetamol for accidental overdoses, and those intending to commit suicide will have to go to multiple stores, giving the person longer to think, rather than act on impulse.

attributes.action: Ban the use of glycophosate on UK food crops
attributes.background: Glycophosate is classified by The World Health Organisation as a "probable carcinogen" and yet it is used by farmers all over the UK on cereal crops as a weed killer to kill the crops before harvesting to make the process easier. Traces remain in our bread.
attributes.additional_details:
The Soil Association has more information here: http://www.soilassociation.org/ourcampaigns/glyphosate/glyphosatedanger

http://www.soilassociation.org/LinkClick.aspx?fileticket=CLfCaRC5p6E%3d&tabid=313

http://www.soilassociation.org/notinourbread

attributes.action: Re-introduce permission to smoke at Psychiatric Hospitals.
attributes.background: This is to improve patient care, understanding, rapport building and compliance with treatment in this difficult setting. The introduction of a ban has led to many barriers in patient care and freedon of choice should be exercised.
attributes.additional_details: Staff and patients alike are now seeing that smoking, although detrimental to health is important for this group of people. It enables better compliance with treatment and allows patients to cope better. Smoking should be re-introduced in the grounds, designated smoking areas and smoking rooms on wards.

attributes.action: Short-termism is a real problem for the long-term good governance of the country
attributes.background: I propose a law that would be called the Posterity Law.  This law would create a rolling oversight agency that would audit the legislation after 4, 8, 12, 16 and 20 years.  If the original legislators were found to be short-termist then they would be penalised by both loss of liberty and wealth.
attributes.additional_details:
To implement this law there would have to be some changes to the Statute of Limitations.

The members of the Oversight Agency would be taken from the general population rather in the manner of Jury Service for short periods.  These members would judge the legislation by the standards of the time.  This would ensure that our elected representatives would consider posterity before enacting legislation.

Any short-termism, opportunism, side-lining of data or lies will be penalised.

attributes.action: Reform council tax for empty properties
attributes.background: Empty properties are now charged 100% council tax despite non use of local facilities. There isn't even an allowance for non person discount rather than single person discount. This penilases (again) landlords that are between tenants or are forced to sell.
attributes.additional_details: I have had to pay 2 lots of council tax on several occasions. One single person discount in the property that I live in here I use all council services and 1 at 100% charge where it has been between tenants and no facilities at all have been used. This investment is my only pension as I am a sole trader and I am again being penalised.

attributes.action: Trident never dismantled, Forever Nuclear deterrence only for the UK's defence.
attributes.background: We the signed would request the government to enshrine into law, that its the nations right and safety that Britain can never have their nuclear deterrence taken away by anyone or any group and forever maintained as a means of deterrence and national safety across the United Kingdom/Territories.
attributes.additional_details: Recently far left groups and leaders of parties have expressed their personal desire to remove the UKs nuclear arsenal and deterrence. Whilst they dream of this notion of 'if we dismantle, others will follow', This has never been the case and it is a matter of national security and defence that we maintain and enshrine that our nuclear deterrence is never taken away by any group or individual. One must wonder had Ukraine never dismantled would they be in the state they are today with Russia?

attributes.action: Protect the public sector from future Private Finance Initiatives (PFI)
attributes.background: PFI’s charge on average 15% interest pa for 30 years. We propose that all future public sector infrastructure projects should be paid for through Public Finance Initiative Bonds (PFIB’s) where members of the general public could invest via the post office into PFIB’s in return for a 5% interest p.a.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is currently paying £3,729 every minute to private companies as part of an annual repayment fee for building and operating new hospitals or redeveloping old ones.
PFIBs could replace PFIs and be similar to National savings bonds where the general public deposit money (say a minimum £1,000 for a minimum of 5 years) via the post office into a PFIB this would be used to build future public infrastructure projects. Even allowing for 5% operating costs this would reduce our costs by over 25%

attributes.action: Theresa May must apologise for policies developed while Home Secretary
attributes.background: She should apologise to thousands of wrongfully deported students. She should apologise to non-EU spouses who had to leave the UK because their partner earned under £18,600. She should apologise to Tier 2 skilled workers being forced to leave the UK for earning under £35k, and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
She has refused to release court records that prove the students were wrongfully deported. She refused to prosecute high-profile journalists accused of phone hacking, one of which worked for the Government. She tried to ban WhatsApp.

She introduced laws that mean 36% of migrant primary teachers and 9% of migrant senior school teachers will be forced to leave the UK, due to the Tier 2 settlement threshold of £35k.

She opposes the Equality Act 2010. She has argued against the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Reform the democratic system to work honestly for the people it serves.
attributes.background:
Many people voted for Brexit to regain power. The ‘remain’ people want the same. It unites us both. We all want to have control over our own lives. Primarily this depends on a government genuinely working for us. This requires a total reformation of our systems of democracy. 
So we demand,
attributes.additional_details:
Proportional representation.
A published declaration of party policies/intentions before general elections, which must be held.
Early general elections called if those promises are broken.
An elected upper house.
A cap on donations of £5000 - instead state funding for a system owned by the people it serves and policies not able to be bought.
A law ensuring the media correct any inaccuracies or misleading statements on the same page, fitting format with the original article, with an apology.

attributes.action: To establish a new bank holiday for the UK to be named "UK Diversity Day".
attributes.background: This day should be celebrated across the UK celebrating the contribution of the many diverse groups across a number of strands of UK society including Age, Disability, Gender, LGBT, Race and Religion. We are a great nation with a great history of embracing diversity and we should celebrate that.

attributes.action: Cross-party statement condemning hate crimes & a debate on firmer punishments
attributes.background: Since the referendum people have been using the result as an opportunity to express racism and hate. This is to ask all political parties and politicians to come together on a joint statement to stand united against racism and hate. Also to ask for a debate on firmer punishments for hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details: This is NOT about how people voted. It's about it being used as an excuse.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on HS2
attributes.background: The establishment has discovered that its opinion on the future of the EU is not aligned with the majority of the British public.  It is very likely that their view on the need for HS2 is also not aligned with the British Public.  Hold a referendum on HS2 so the public can decide.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a petition about stopping development of necessary infrastructure and destroying communities along the way, but one about the potentially unnecessary expenditure of tens of billions of pounds equivalent to 6 years of savings made by leaving the EU.  Other options have not been considered such as double decker trains.  There are double decker options that can fit under most existing tunnels by using space under the train too.  There is also video conferencing!

attributes.action: Bring in informed consent legislation for elections and referendums.
attributes.background: It is currently legal for political bodies to use false or misleading information in the run up to a vote. Introducing Free, Prior, Informed Consent(FPIC) legislation for elections would hold politicians accountable for misleading or manipulating voters as well as make sure people are aware of risks
attributes.additional_details: Many voters have said they did not fully understand the EU referendum. Politicians used false figures and misleading information in official campaigns to manipulate voters’ decisions. This impinges on voters’ right to self-determination, because they were not fully informed. There is legislation to protect the same rights in other professions, there should also be similar ones for politics and government.

attributes.action: A Judicial Review on the exclusion of 16 to 18 year olds from the EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Scottish Referendum allowed 16 to 18 year olds to vote but the EU Referendum, which impacts the young disproportionately, did not. This decision was seemingly  based on cost considerations not on the legal precedence that has been set.

attributes.action: Require large companies to pay invoices within 30 days of invoice date.
attributes.background: Large companies impose onerous payment periods on small companies. Small companies are unable to resist because of their lack of power. This results in large companies using small companies as another source of funding.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, to add a further level of difficulty, the large companies have created a charge mechanism for invoices paid in a lesser time. It is quite common for large companies to pay smaller companies in periods of 90 - 120  days.

attributes.action: Propose a referendum on whether or not HM Government should trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the fact UK citizens can now see it's effect more clearly and are better informed of future plans, we the undersigned propose HM Government hold a further referendum on whether or not to trigger Article50. The result of this should then determine a 2nd referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is due to the sheer number of people expressing they voted incorrectly to leave, some as a "dissatisfaction" vote and the fact the vote was too close to be a satisfactory result. Also the backtracking on spending proposals (eg NHS) clearly left many feeling deceived by the out campaign. UK citizens deserve honesty and integrity from their leaders to make truely informed decisions and that did not happen.

attributes.action: If 2nd referendum occurs, change rules. Give 16+ & expats ex uk 15 + yrs a vote.
attributes.background:
Before any new referendum Lower the voting age to 16
Allow expats out of the uk more than 15 years to have a vote
attributes.additional_details:
* The younger generation should be allowed to have a say on their own future. Not have it made for them by a much older generation.

* Expats like me, British passport , ex British army but lived in another member state, ( and have a business France for 16 years promoting and selling uk products ) were not allowed a say on such an important vote.

attributes.action: Hold binding referenda in cities/regions to vote on independence from the UK.
attributes.background: Post EU referendum 49% of the voting population are unhappy with the result. 2 countries and many large cities voted to stay, there is a massive divide in the politics, with fundamentally opposed ideas. The UK should allow these regions to vote on independence from the UK in binding referenda.
attributes.additional_details:
Given the uncertainty and issues that will arise from leaving the EU and new political leadership. We should seriously consider the alternative options available if cities or regions were to vote for independence and remain in the EU.

https://ig.ft.com/sites/elections/2016/uk/eu-referendum/
http://www.newsweek.com/london-sadiq-khan-brexit-londependence-independence-referendum-474356
http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-36616028
http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36626201

attributes.action: Rerun the EU referendum with compulsory voting and reduce the voting age to 16.
attributes.background: The decision to leave or remain in the EU is one that will affect every person in this country. As such this decision requires agreement from every single member of the population to ensure that we make the right choice. This includes those aged 16 -17 who were allowed their say in similar referenda
attributes.additional_details: The recent EU referendum discriminates against the youth based on the precedent of being allowed to vote at 16+ in the Scottish Referendum. There are also those who did not vote in the recent referendum who may now wish to add their voice to whether to remain or leave the EU. Considering the closeness of the result. A compulsory vote of all citizens aged 16+ is required to settle this issue once and for all with full agreement of the population as its implications affects all citizens.

attributes.action: Create independent body to call re-elections if campaign promises are not kept
attributes.background:
Create an independent body to call snap elections/referendums, protecting our right to Democratic representation

Reverse the current trend of politicians basing campaigns on promises publicised to secure votes, then immediately discarded

Key promises must be identified+independently monitored
attributes.additional_details:
The Leave campaign's pre-vote promises: 
https://goo.gl/DuYSZg

4 key promises retracted in first 24 hours: https://goo.gl/i83HYK

9 key pre-election promises broken by Tory Gov't in 1st 100 days: http://goo.gl/ZkgEqa

More pre-election promises immediately discarded: http://goo.gl/H3pnZM

If we are unable to vote on issues we want represented then we do not live in a functioning democracy

Intentions should be clearly stated as separate from promises. Promises should include dates for review

attributes.action: Not to invoke Article 50 until the year 2026.
attributes.background:
Leaving the EU because a political party used the promise of an in out referendum on our European membership as an electoral bribe was both ethically and morally wrong. 
For this, and many other reasons, I feel that a prolonged period of reflection is needed before Article 50 is invoked.

attributes.action: Create a TV advert explaining to people who voted remain how democracy works.
attributes.background: It has become clear since the referendum result was announced that a significant number of the population do not understand how the democratic process works. This is an issue which a skilfully crafted TV advert will help to address.

attributes.action: Improve the representation of the British people in the UK parliament.
attributes.background:
We ask that parliament gives the British people a yes/no referendum on this question by June 2019:

“Do you want the UK to have an elected second house to represent the regional needs of the British people and proportional representation in the House of Commons to form all future governments?
attributes.additional_details:
There has been a growing need for reform of our democratic system for the last few decades. 

We feel that this is needed to improve communication between the political elite and the British people and to make our democracy more representative of the full spectrum of the view points held by our citizens.

attributes.action: Make future UK referendum results require a majority of 60%
attributes.background: Referendums are called by the UK government on matters of major constitutional change. Any major change from the status quo should have the backing of at least 60% of those who vote in each referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Recent referendums have demonstrated the strongly devisive nature of proposed major changes to people's lives, especially when the result is close to an even split. Having to reach a qualified majority of 60% in any UK referendum would help ensure that changes are more widely accepted amongst the electorate.

attributes.action: Block George Osborne's emergency budget proposal, if Britain leaves the EU
attributes.background: George Osborne has announced that if Britain leaves the EU, he will be forced to raise taxes and cut spending to prevent an economic meltdown. Not only is the 'evidence' used to suggest this just based on wild predictions and scaremongering, but it also contradicts the 2015 conservative manifesto.

attributes.action: Make it an illegal offence for women to smoke/drink/use drugs whilst pregnant.
attributes.background: People know the risks of tobacco, alcohol and drugs, we all know the risks and dangers we're exposed to, we wouldn't dream of giving these to children, never mind newborn babies. So why do so many women continue to use these whilst pregnant? They are knowingly harming their unborn child.
attributes.additional_details:
Just like smoking and drinking, drugs have a major effect on a baby, the least of which is giving birth to a baby who is addicted to the drug. The consequences of using cocaine, for example, include heart attack, respiratory failure, strokes, and seizures, and all these life-threatening health problems can also be passed to an unborn baby.

All these products increase the risk of miscarriage, low birth weight, health complications and risks later in life, including mental health problems.

attributes.action: I would like you to ban birds that are kept in cages.
attributes.background: I would like to ban people from selling and buying birds as pets and keeping them in cages as I think it is very cruel for them to spend their lifetime in a cage and not being able to fly freely like they should do. Birds are born to fly and don't deserve a life like this...
